citation.article-title: Tistrella bauzanensis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tistrella bauzanensis sp. nov.
Tistrella bauzanensis [bau.zan.en′sis. N.L. fem. adj. bauzanensis referring to Bauzanum (latin name of Bozen/Bolzano), a city in South Tyrol, Italy, from where the type strain was isolated].

Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, strictly aerobic and rod-shaped (1.0–1.2×1.5–12 µm after 5 days at 20 °C on R2A agar); they often occur in chains with a length of approximately 12 µm and are motile.
Colonies on R2A agar are white, round, convex and smooth with entire margin; colony diameter is about 1 mm after 5 days at 20 °C on R2A agar.
Growth occurs on R2A, nutrient agar and TSA.
Good growth on R2A plates and in liquid R2A medium occurs at 1–25 °C; growth is weak at 30 °C and absent at 37 °C.
In liquid culture, growth rate is highest at 25 °C but cell yields are highest at 10–20 °C.
On R2A agar plates, growth is observed at pH 7 and in the presence of 0–5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Positive for nitrate reduction and production of indole from tryptophan.
Negative for hydrogen sulfide production and hydrolysis of urea, starch, aesculin and gelatin.

Positive for catalase, cytochrome c oxidase, acid phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase activities; weakly positive for alkaline phosphatase and valine arylamidase activities; negative for arginine dihydrolase, lysine dihydrolase, ornithine dihydrolase, lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α- and β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase and α-mannosidase activities.
Assimilates malic acid but not d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, potassium gluconate, N-acetylglucosamine, adipic acid, capric acid or phenylacetic acid as a sole carbon source.
Negative for fermentation of all 49 organic substrates in the API 50 CH system.
Sensitive to kanamycin, amikacin, rifampicin and neomycin (each 30 µg) but resistant to chloramphenicol (30 µg), tetracycline (30 µg) and erythromycin (15 µg).
The predominant cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C19 : 0ω8c cyclo, C18 : 1 2-OH and C14 : 0 3-OH.
The type strain, BZ78T ( = DSM 22817T = CGMCC 1.10188T = LMG 26047T), was isolated from hydrocarbon-contaminated soil in Bozen, South Tyrol, Italy.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.8 mol%.
